American Recordings (record label).label: American Recordings
American Recordings (record label).description: American Recordings is a Los Angeles-based record label headed by record producer Rick Rubin. Formerly known as Def American Recordings; the label has been home to Slayer, the Black Crowes, ZZ Top, ... Wikipedia

Avex Trax.label: Avex Trax
Avex Trax.description: Avex Trax is a record label owned by Japanese entertainment conglomerate Avex Group. The label was launched in September 1990, and was the first label by the Group. Wikipedia

CBS Records.label: CBS Records
CBS Records.description: CBS Records is a record label founded by CBS Corporation in 2006 to take advantage of music from its entertainment properties owned by CBS Television Studios. Wikipedia

Cameo Records.label: Cameo Records
Cameo Records.description:
Cameo was a USA based budget record label, first flourishing in the 1920s, not connected with a later record label of the same name which was active in the 1950s and 1960s.
The Cameo Record Company was based in Manhattan, New York. Wikipedia

Cash Money Records.label: Cash Money Records
Cash Money Records.description: Cash Money Records is an American record label founded by brothers Bryan "Birdman" Williams and Ronald "Slim" Williams, who currently act as CEOs. Wikipedia

Daylight Records.label: Daylight Records
Daylight Records.description: Daylight Records was an American record label and subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment, operated through Epic Records. Wikipedia

EMI Latin.label: EMI Latin
EMI Latin.description: EMI Televisa Music, also known as EMI Latin and EMI International, is a subsidiary of EMI which focuses on Latin American music. Wikipedia

Fania Records.label: Fania Records
Fania Records.description: Fania Records was a New York based record label founded by Dominican-born composer and bandleader Johnny Pacheco and Italian-American lawyer Jerry Masucci in 1964. The label took its name from an old Cuban song by the singer Reinaldo Bola√±o. Wikipedia

GOOD Music.label: GOOD Music
GOOD Music.description: GOOD Music is an American record label founded by hip hop recording artist and record producer Kanye West in 2004. Wikipedia

GUN Records.label: GUN Records
GUN Records.description:
GUN Records was a record label located in Bochum, Northrhine-Westphalia, Germany and was founded 1992 by Bogdan Kopec and Wolfgang Funk.
Different artists on the label have had hit singles as also albums in Europe. Wikipedia

Harthouse.label: Hart House Theatre
Harthouse.description: Hart House Theatre is a 454-seat theatre in Toronto, Ontario located on the campus of the University of Toronto in the Hart House Student Centre. Hart House Theatre has been the University of Toronto Performing Arts Leader Since 1919. Wikipedia

His Master's Voice.label: His Master's Voice
His Master's Voice.description: His Master's Voice, abbreviated HMV, is a trademark in the music business, and for many years was the name of a large record label. The name was coined in 1899 as the title of a painting of the dog Nipper listening to a wind-up gramophone. Wikipedia

Homestead Records.label: Homestead Records
Homestead Records.description: Homestead Records was a Long Island, New York-based sublabel of music distributor Dutch East India Trading. It was founded in 1984 by Sam Berger, who was the American independent buyer for Dutch East India Trading. Wikipedia

K Records.label: K Records
K Records.description: K Records is an independent record label in Olympia, Washington, co-founded, owned, and operated by Calvin Johnson, formerly of the bands Cool Rays, Beat Happening, The Go Team, The Halo Benders and ... Wikipedia

Kill Rock Stars.label: Kill Rock Stars
Kill Rock Stars.description: Kill Rock Stars is an independent record label founded in 1991 by Slim Moon and Tinuviel Sampson, and based in both Olympia, Washington and Portland, Oregon. Wikipedia

Luaka Bop.label: Luaka Bop
Luaka Bop.description: Luaka Bop is a world music-oriented record label established by David Byrne, former guitarist, singer-songwriter and producer of the art rock-new wave band Talking Heads. It has been a wholly independent label since leaving V2 in 2006. Wikipedia

Magic Circle Music.label: Magic Circle Music
Magic Circle Music.description: Magic Circle Music was founded by Manowar bassist Joey DeMaio in 2005 named after Richard Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen by which DeMaio is highly inspired. The purpose of the label is to give the band complete creative control of their operation. Wikipedia

Magnatune.label: Magnatune
Magnatune.description: Magnatune is an American independent record label based in Berkeley, California, founded in spring 2003. Wikipedia

MonarC Entertainment.label: Monarc Entertainment
MonarC Entertainment.description: Monarc Entertainment was an American record label formed by Mariah Carey, under Island Records. The name comes from Carey's well-documented fascination with butterflies. Wikipedia

Ninja Tune.label: Ninja Tune
Ninja Tune.description: Ninja Tune is an independent record label in London, England founded by Matt Black and Jonathan More, better known as Coldcut and managed by Peter Quicke and others. Wikipedia

Okeh Records.label: Okeh Records
Okeh Records.description: Okeh Records began as the Otto Heinemann Phonograph Corp., a supplier of phonographs based in the United States of America in 1916, branching out into phonograph records in 1918. From 1926 on, it was a subsidiary of Columbia Records. Wikipedia

Relativity Records.label: Relativity Records
Relativity Records.description: Relativity Records, often branded just Relativity, was an American record label founded by Barry Kobrin at the site of his company, Important Record Distributors in metro New York. Wikipedia

Rephlex Records.label: Rephlex Records
Rephlex Records.description: Rephlex Records is a record label started in 1991 by electronic musician Richard D. James and Grant Wilson-Claridge. Rephlex coined the term braindance to describe the otherwise uncategorisable output of Aphex Twin and Rephlex Records. Wikipedia

Revelation Records.label: Revelation Records
Revelation Records.description: Revelation Records is an independent record label focusing originally and primarily on hardcore punk. Wikipedia

Ruff Ryders Entertainment.label: Ruff Ryders Entertainment
Ruff Ryders Entertainment.description: Ruff Ryders Entertainment was a record label founded by brothers Darrin "Dee" Dean and Joaquin "Waah" Dean, uncles of producer Swizz Beatz. It operated as a subsidiary of Universal Music Group, and was distributed by Fontana Distribution. Wikipedia

SST Records.label: SST Records
SST Records.description: SST Records is an American independent record label formed in 1978 in Long Beach, California by musician Greg Ginn. Wikipedia

Saddle Creek Records.label: Saddle Creek Records
Saddle Creek Records.description: Saddle Creek Records is an American record label based in Omaha, Nebraska. Started as a college class project on entrepreneurship, the label was founded by Mike Mogis and Justin Oberst in 1993. Wikipedia

Studio !K7.label: Studio !K7
Studio !K7.description: Studio !K7 is an independent record label based in Berlin, Germany that focuses mostly on electronic music. The name is an abbreviation of the company's original Berlin address, Kaiserdamm 7. Wikipedia

Sun Records.label: Sun Records
Sun Records.description: Sun Records is an American independent record label founded in Memphis, Tennessee, starting operations on March 27, 1952. Wikipedia

Threshold Records.label: Threshold Records
Threshold Records.description:
Threshold Records was a record label created by The Moody Blues, after their 1969 album On the Threshold of a Dream.
It was a UK subsidiary of Decca Records and a U.S. subsidiary of London Records. Wikipedia

Verve Records.label: Verve Music Group
Verve Records.description: Verve Records is an American jazz record label now owned by Universal Music Group. It was founded by Norman Granz in 1956, absorbing the catalogues of his earlier labels, Clef Records and Norgran Records, ... Wikipedia

ZE Records.label: ZE Records
ZE Records.description: ZE Records was originally a New York-based record label, started in 1978 by Michael Zilkha and Michel Esteban. It has been re-established by Esteban since 2003. Wikipedia

Apple Records.label: Apple Records
Apple Records.description: Apple Records is a record label founded by the Beatles in 1968, as a division of Apple Corps Ltd. It was initially intended as a creative outlet for the Beatles, both as a group and individually, plus ... Wikipedia

CMC International.label: CMC International
CMC International.description: CMC International was an American independent record label founded by Tom Lipsky in 1991, focused mainly on classic rock, and classic heavy metal. Wikipedia

Columbia Records.label: Columbia
Columbia Records.description: Columbia Records is a premier recording label, under the ownership of Sony Music Entertainment, operating under the Columbia Music Group. Wikipedia

Deep Elm Records.label: Deep Elm Records
Deep Elm Records.description: Deep Elm Records is an independent record label putting out albums by bands such as Lights & Motion, The Appleseed Cast, Brandtson, The White Octave, and Planes Mistaken for Stars. Wikipedia

Definitive Jux.label: Definitive Jux
Definitive Jux.description: Definitive Jux is an independent record label based in New York City, United States. It was co-founded in 1999 by Jaime Meline and Amaechi Uzoigwe. Wikipedia

Dischord Records.label: Dischord Records
Dischord Records.description: Dischord Records is a Washington, D.C.-based independent record label specializing in the independent punk music of the D.C.-area music scene. Wikipedia

Epitaph Records.label: Epitaph Records
Epitaph Records.description: Epitaph Records is a Hollywood, California based independent record label owned by Bad Religion guitarist Brett Gurewitz. Wikipedia

Geffen Records.label: Geffen Records
Geffen Records.description: Geffen Records is an American record label, owned by Universal Music Group, which operates as one third of the Interscope Geffen A&M label group. Wikipedia

J Records.label: J Records
J Records.description: J Records was an American record label owned and operated by Sony Music Entertainment, and was distributed through the RCA Music Group. The label was founded in 2000 and was dissolved into RCA Records in 2011. Wikipedia

LaFace Records.label: LaFace Records
LaFace Records.description: LaFace Records is an American record label owned by Sony Music Entertainment that was most active, and achieved its greatest commercial success, during the 1990s; dealing largely in the field of urban music. Wikipedia

Mute Records.label: Mute Records
Mute Records.description: Mute is a British record label. It was founded in 1978 by Daniel Miller and featured several prominent musical acts on its roster such as Depeche Mode, Erasure, Fad Gadget, Goldfrapp, Grinderman, Moby, Nitzer Ebb, Wire and Yazoo. Wikipedia

Virgin Records.label: Virgin Records
Virgin Records.description: Virgin Records is a British record label founded by English entrepreneur Richard Branson, Simon Draper, Nik Powell and Tom Newman in 1972. Wikipedia

Warp (record label).label: Warp
Warp (record label).description: Warp, commonly referred to as Warp Records, is a pioneering independent British record label, founded in Sheffield in 1989, notable for discovering some of the more enduring artists in electronic music. Wikipedia

1965 Records.label: 1965 Records
1965 Records.description: 1965 Records is a London-based subsidiary record label of SonyBMG. Formed in 2006, the label was founded by James Endeacott, who first signed The Libertines. Wikipedia

2Point9 Records.label: 2Point9 Records
2Point9 Records.description: 2Point9 Records is an independent record label, a subsidiary of an all-in-one entertainment company called 2Point9, that was started in 2003 when Telstar Records A&R manager Billy Grant and Promotions ... Wikipedia

2 Tone Records.label: 2 Tone Records
2 Tone Records.description: 2 Tone Records was an English record label that mostly released ska and reggae-influenced music with a punk rock and pop music overtone. It was founded by Jerry Dammers of The Specials and backed by Chrysalis Records. Wikipedia

4AD.label: 4AD
4AD.description: 4AD is a British independent record label that was started in 1979 by Ivo Watts-Russell and Peter Kent, originally funded by Beggars Banquet Records. Wikipedia

A&E Records.label: A&E Records
A&E Records.description: A&E Records is a United Kingdom-based record label imprint, owned by Warner Music Group, and operates under the WEA International group of labels at WMG. Wikipedia

AM PM Records.label: AM PM Records
AM PM Records.description: AMPM Records was the dance division of A&M Records Ltd in Great Britain. It was disbanded after A&M's owner PolyGram merged with Universal Music Group. Wikipedia

ASV Records.label: ASV Records
ASV Records.description: ASV Records is a London-based record label set up by Harley Usill, founder of Argo Records, Decca producer and former Argo General Manager, Kevin Daly, and producer Jack Boyce, after Argo's parent company Decca was bought by Polygram in 1980. Wikipedia

ATIC Records.label: ATIC Records
ATIC Records.description: ATIC Records is an independent record label formed by British musician, DJ and producer, Aim and Niko. They left Grand Central Records in early 2005 and started ATIC Records in June 2006. Wikipedia

A New Day Records.label: A New Day Records
A New Day Records.description: A New Day is a record label from England. It was founded by Dave Rees and evolved from his Jethro Tull fanzine of that name. Wikipedia

Acid Jazz Records.label: Acid Jazz Records
Acid Jazz Records.description: Acid Jazz is a record label based in east London. It takes its name from acid jazz, a genre of jazz music. Alternative version states that the genre itself was named after the record label. Wikipedia

Adaadat.label: ADAADAT
Adaadat.description: Adaadat is an Independent record label based in London releasing an eclectic mixture of Experimental Music, Chiptune, Noise Music, Art Rock, IDM and Breakcore. It was founded in 2002 by Angus Keith and Bjorn Hatleskog. Wikipedia

Agit-Prop Records.label: Agit-Prop Records
Agit-Prop Records.description: Agit-Prop Records was an independent record label founded in 1985 by the members of the then-peace punk band Chumbawamba. Wikipedia

All Saints Records.label: All Saints Records
All Saints Records.description: All Saints Records is a British independent record label. It was established in 1991 by Dominic Norman-Taylor. They have published ambient music from the likes of Brian Eno and Biosphere. Wikipedia

Almost Gold Recordings.label: Almost Gold Recordings
Almost Gold Recordings.description: Almost Gold Recordings is an independent record label. It was originally founded in 2007 in New York City by Scott Rodger of Quest Management with distribution in North America through Columbia Records. Wikipedia

Anhrefn Records.label: Anhrefn Records
Anhrefn Records.description:
Recordiau Anhrefn was a record label established in 1983 by Rhys Mwyn.
Based in the small mid-Wales village of Llanfair Caereinion, before Rhys and his brother Sion Sebon moved to Bangor, North Wales, ... Wikipedia

Ankstmusik.label: Ankst
Ankstmusik.description: Ankst was a Welsh independent record label formed in 1988 at the University of Wales, Aberystwyth by Alun Llwyd, Gruffudd Jones and Emyr Glyn Williams. Wikipedia

Ambiel Music.label: Ambiel Music
Ambiel Music.description:
Ambiel Music is an British independent record label.
Founded in April 2007, Ambiel Music cater for up and coming artists and are a strong supporter of Independent music from several different genres and styles. Wikipedia

Anticulture Records.label: Anticulture Records
Anticulture Records.description:
Anticulture Records Ltd is a record label based in Northampton, England which deals mostly with heavy metal music.
The first release for Anticulture was Gutworm's 'Ruin The Memory' album in April 2004. Wikipedia

Angular Recording Corporation.label: Angular Recording Corporation
Angular Recording Corporation.description: Angular Recording Corporation is an independent record label originally based in New Cross, South East London. Wikipedia

Antidote Records.label: Antidote
Antidote Records.description: Antidote Records is an independent UK record label. Wikipedia

Atlantic Jaxx.label: Atlantic Jaxx
Atlantic Jaxx.description: Atlantic Jaxx is a record company founded and owned by electronica / house music duo Basement Jaxx. Wikipedia

Awakening Records.label: Awakening Records
Awakening Records.description: Awakening Records was created in 2000 to offer a wide range of products for a new modern Islamic music market. Wikipedia

Azuli Records.label: Azuli Records
Azuli Records.description: Azuli Records is an independent record label, focusing mainly on house music and other forms of electronic dance music. The label was founded by DJ Dave Piccioni in London, UK in 1991 and went into liquidation in April 2009. Wikipedia

BBC Radio Collection.label: BBC Radio Collection
BBC Radio Collection.description: The BBC Radio Collection was an imprint or record label used for audio books from the British Broadcasting Corporation, mainly of previously broadcast material. As a label it was replaced by BBC Audio in 2004. Wikipedia

Babel Label.label: Babel Label
Babel Label.description: The Babel Label is a record label founded in 1994 by Oliver Weindling. It primarily records and releases jazz albums from UK artists. Ongoing relationships include artists such as Billy Jenkins, Christine Tobin and Huw Warren. Wikipedia

Awareness Records.label: Awareness Records
Awareness Records.description: Awareness Records was a record label founded in the mid-1980s by its owner, Andy Ware. The label was based in England and had Roy Harper and Michael Nesmith among its artists. It has now gone out of business. Wikipedia

Back Yard Recordings.label: Back Yard Recordings
Back Yard Recordings.description:
Back Yard recordings is a UK independent record label based in London.
The label was set up by Gil Goldberg and can count acts such as Gossip, Chromeo, Seelenluft, The Similou, Ali Love and Teenagersintokyo amongst its roster. Wikipedia

Bad Sekta.label: Bad Sekta
Bad Sekta.description: Bad Sekta is an independent English record label founded in Halstead in 2005, with a mission statement to release new music and video by underground & experimental electronic music artists. Wikipedia

Badorb.com.label: Badorb.com
Badorb.com.description: Badorb.com was a record label created by Alex Paterson of The Orb in 2002. Though it was an internet label, its releases were vinyl only, which Paterson believed was the reason the label failed and closed in 2003. Wikipedia

Barely Breaking Even.label: Barely Breaking Even
Barely Breaking Even.description: Barely Breaking Even is a British record label started by two DJs, Peter Adarkwah and Ben Jolly. The name BBE comes from The Universal Robot Band's 1982 track `Barely Breaking Even'. It has two sublabels Deep Funk, and Urban Theory. Wikipedia

Anjunadeep.label: Anjunadeep
Anjunadeep.description: Anjunadeep is a sub-label of British trance label Anjunabeats, set up in 2005. It releases progressive house and deep house records, as opposed to the primarily uplifting and progressive trance of its parent label. Wikipedia

infoboxless: The Island Def Jam Music Group
